course_title: Senior Seminar: Go To Market Strategies SaaS
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 8Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Mondays, 9:00-11:00am, GBS 421, Class Dates: 9/11, 9/18, 9/25, 10/2, 10/16, alternate date: 10/23


Seminar Description: This course provides an overview of the key concepts and tools needed to develop and implement effective GTM strategies for a real world SaaS business. Topics covered include SaaS business model, valuation, pricing and packaging, subscription life cycle, and tools and technology used to scale up a SaaS business. We will conclude the class by exploring the career opportunities for students in SaaS companies and at founding a SaaS business.


Instructor: Himaja Sonthi works as Director of SaaS Transformation in VMware a cloud computing company. In her current role she works on devising, planning and executing GTM strategy to increase the ARR for the business. She is a technologist who evolved to be a business leader. She has an MS in Computer Science from Georgia Institute of Technology and an MBA from Goizueta Business School. In her free time, she loves traveling with her family and hiking mountains.
course_description: Senior seminar courses fall outside the scope of traditional academic coursework, and instead allow students to learn from and interact with experienced practitioners, and to develop industry-specific insights, fine-tune career skills, and increase professional exposure.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the BBA program.
sections: Class Nbr: 6665, Section #: 1119, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 9-11a, Instructor: A. Hershatter, Status: Open
